column10: Documentary on the Craigard Day Centre in Lochmaddy% North Uist
Craigard client dicussing his weekly routine at the centre

Flora Macdonald% a North Uist resident% talks first of all about the importance of Craigard in the community% and her own interactions with Donald MacKinnon. She goes on to describe her reasons for setting up the traditional skills exhibition in Taigh Chearsabhagh% and her own thoughts on their place in the community today.

column7: Gordon Wells% Mairi 'V' MacInnes (other unidentified contributors on video)

Craftsman Seumas talking about his work at Cothrom Re-Store
Director of Cothrom community group discussing the group's responsibilities and activities
Documentary on the Hebriden Smokehouse in Clachan% North Uist

Alasdair MacEachen is an Environmental Health Officer in Benbecula. He describes the implications of his job in terms of both enforcement and education% in particular relation to food handling and production.
Documentary on a cooking demonstration in Daliburgh% South Uist% hosted by Ceòlas
Isabel Graham is a well-known hotelier and cook at the Orasay Inn in South Uist. Here she describes how she uses local produce when preparing meals for guests.
Documentary on Ceòlas music and language summer school in Daliburgh% South Uist
Mairi V MacInnes% chair of Ceòlas committee% talks about the annual summer school
Ceòlas administrator talking about her role in the summer school

Ruairidh MacIllEathain is a well-known Gaelic broadcaster with a particular interest in Gaelic learners. He is attending Ceòlas for the first time. He talks about the quality of the instruction in his chosen subjects% and assesses the value of the school for learners of Gaelic.
Documentary on the Taigh Chearsabhagh Museum in Lochmaddy% Uist
Caitriona MacCuish is the Heritage Officer at Taigh Chearsabhagh. She describes what the job entails and what she enjoys about working there.

Donald Ferguson speaks as a student on the first year of the BA in Fine Art that is hosted by Taigh Chearsabhagh. He describes and comments on the facilities in the centre and the quality of services and teaching staff on the course.

column7: Gordon Wells% James MacLetchie% Kevin de Las Casas
column10: Documentary on songwriting parternship 'Bi Beò'

James McLetchie talks about what prompted him to write the words to the song “Na seann daoine”. He explains the references to local people and family members% talks about the importance of social customs and the physical environment in Uist% and reflects on how things have changed in his local community.
Seumas sings 'Na Seann Daoine'% composed by himself
